name: treatment of used refrigerant R134a, reclamation | used refrigerant R134a | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14107/documentation

This dataset represent treatment of used refrigerant R134a by reclamation.;The refrigerant R134a is widely used refrigerant (mainly in automobile air conditioning systems and othere refrigeration and cooling technolodges). It can be treated by primary three different technologies; 1) venting, 2) reclamation and 3) final disposal. ;Since the R134a causes global warming venting as a way of treatment is forbidden in some countries. For example in the US (US EPA, http://www.epa.gov/ozone/title6/608/faq.html, accessed 20141105).

The activity starts, when the used refrigerant is accepted for treatment.

There are no data on the amount of energy needed during this process.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Reclamation refers to the reprocessing of used HFC-134a to new product specifications. Quality of reclaimed product is verified by chemical analysis (DuPont, HFC-134a Technical Information, http://www2.dupont.com/Refrigerants/en_US/assets/downloads/h45945_hfc134a_push.pdf, accessed 20141105).;The machine for R-134a reclaim are mostly portable machineries for cars. Their functions are mainly recovery, vacuuming and charging. Recovery is the process to recover the R-134a and purifying it, the purified refrigerant is then stored in the machine. Vacuuming the car is to eliminate any residuals to prevent contamination. Charging is then insertion of the refrigerant (http://wonderfu.buy.lightneasy.org/pz66c0ed9-fully-automatic-r134a-recovery-machine-and-refrigerant-charging-machine.html, accessed 20150924).

exchanges.description: Estimated value. It is estimated, that during the reclamation 10% of the refrigerant is not possible to reclamate and is disposed of as a hazardous waste.
